Class oracle.html.Applet 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index  OWS Table of Contents

Class oracle.html.Applet 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----oracle.html.Item
           |
           +----oracle.html.Applet
public class Applet
extends Item
implements IVAlign, IHAlign
Description:

Applet encapsulates an APPLET element as specified in JavaSoft's JDK (Java Development Kit) version 1.0

Instructions:

Use this class to incorporate Java applets into your HtmlPage.

Example: 

// Create a new Applet object with the following attributes:
// Applet file name:  "NervousText.class"
// Width of Applet Window:  400
// Height of Applet Window:  75
// Parameter:   Name="text", Value="This is an applet test"
Applet applet = new Applet("NervousText.class", 400, 75);
applet.addParam("text", "This is an applet test.");

See Also:
Item, IVAlign, IHAlign

Applet(String, int, int)
Creates an Applet Object

addParam(String, String)
Adds a parameter (applet specific attribute)
endTag()
Return the end Tag for this item
print()
Print the content of object as HTML string to System.out
setAlign(String)
Sets the alignment attribute of the applet
setAltHtml(Item)
Sets alternative Html Items
setAltHtml(Container)
Sets alternative Html Items
setAltText(String)
Sets the text that should be displayed if the browser understands the APPLET tag but cannot run Java applet.
setCode(String)
Set the naem of thefile that contains the applet's compiled Applet subclass.
setCodebase(String)
Sets the code base (the base URL of the applet)
setHSpace(int)
Sets the number of pixels on each side of the applet window
setHeight(int)
Sets the number of pixels of height of the applet window
setName(String)
Sets the instance name of the applet
setVSpace(int)
Sets the number of pixels above and below the applet window
setWidth(int)
Sets the number of pixels of the width of the applet window
startTag()
Return the start Tag of this item
toHTML()
Returns content of object as HTML string
Implementation Note: Objct should be both browser-independent and browser-aware
toString()

Applet 
  public Applet(String code,
                int width,
                int height)
Creates an Applet Object
Parameters:
code - appletfile (e.g. "NervousText.class")
width - width of applet window in pixels
height - height of applet window in pixels
